item.title: Nuclear Experts Say Mixing AI and Nuclear Weapons Is Inevitable
item.description: Human judgement remains central to the launch of nuclear weapons. But experts say it’s a matter of when, not if, artificial intelligence will get baked into the world’s most dangerous systems.

item.title: Life After the Atomic Blast, as Told by Hiroshima’s Survivors
item.description: Eighty years after the dropping of the first atomic bomb, Hiroshima’s survivors and their descendants describe how health problems and stigma have echoed down the generations.

item.title: The History and Physics of the Atomic Bomb
item.description: First came the idea of splitting the atom; then, a chain of events leading to a moment forever etched in collective memory—the use of nuclear weapons on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945.
